definition: circumstances of the people/popular sentiment/the mood of the people/popular customs

sentences.english: The leaders should observe the people's condition.
However, in terms of Hong Kong people's sentiment, their net effect is just barely noticeable.
sentences.chinese: 不過，以香港民情而論，整體反應似乎未算太大。

sentences.english: To be acquainted with the merit of ministry, we need only observe the condition of the people.
sentences.chinese: 要了解政府的政績只需要觀察民情。

sentences.english: The tasks will test their intelligence, chutzpah and street-smarts.
sentences.chinese: 這些任務將考驗他們的智慧，膽大和熟知都市民情。

sentences.english: Conduct courses generally using the RLI curriculum, which may be revised to be consistent with local customs and traditions.
sentences.chinese: 的課程，該課程得加以修正以配合當地風俗民情。

sentences.english: A public outcry in Thailand caused both governments to send troops to the area.
sentences.chinese: 由於泰國民情激憤，兩國政府都派兵駐守該地區。

definition: to make an investigative visit/to go and find out from the source
to visit the poor and ask about their suffering (idiom)
Aimin district of Mudanjiang city 牡丹江市, Heilongjiang
style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
mulberry farming/to grow mulberry for sericulture
